_description: The Northern version of Cato’s Distiches — in couplets

BodRawG59.First Lines:
When I auysed me ryght hertelyHow dyuerse men eren
                    grevously…
BodRawG59.Last Lines:
…Certis my scherte wytt made hittThat I tweyn to gedir
                    knytt
BodRawG59.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Ein nordenglische Cato-Version.” 
             Englische Studien
         36 (1906) 1-55: 5-55 (odd pages).

CamSidney63.First Lines:
Cum animaduerterem quam plures homines
                    Whan I bethenke me hertli
                    How fele men erren greuousli…
CamSidney63.Last Lines:
…certis in schort witte made itt
                    Þat I tweien & tweien to geder knitt
                    Explicit / Cato
CamSidney63.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Ein nordenglische Cato-Version.” 
             Englische Studien
         36 (1906) 1-55: 4-54 (even pages).

CopenThott306.Editions:
Brusendorff,  Aage. 
             “‘He Knew Nat Catoun for His Wit Was Rude.’” 
             Studies in English Philology: A Miscellany in Honor of Frederick
                Klaeber.
            Kemp Malone,
                              and  Martin B. Ruud,
                            eds. 
         Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1929: 320-39: 323-4.
